page.title: 19Estate Management.
page.content: Land drainage has improved agriculture.Some tree planting has taken place to give cover for wildlife The integration of forestry, farming & shooting interests is present policy.A factor runs the estate & a Manager the Home Farm. Pheasant shooting is excellent & by good keepering & feeding in hard winter months,the quality & number of birds is improved. The onset of disease & bad weather during breeding seasons has caused a decrease in Grouse on Highland moors. Considerable effort is presently going on to ensure their revival as grouse shooting is seen to be a major asset in the area.Trout fishing in the River Don must be amongst the best in Scotland.Salmon runs have been poor recently due to the pollution of the Estuary but Landowners have sought to rectify this & now see an improvement.
